sen.j: 舞鶴県（まいづるけん）は廃藩置県により1871年（明治4年）に設置された県。
sen.e: Maizuru Prefecture is a prefecture established in 1871 based on the policy of Haihan-chiken (abolition of feudal domains and establishment of prefectures).
Maizuru Prefecture is a prefecture established in 1871 based on the policy of Haihan-chiken (abolition of feudal domains and establishment of prefectures).
Maizuru Prefecture is a prefecture established in 1871 based on the policy of Haihan-chiken (abolition of feudal domains and establishment of prefectures).

sen.j: 同年10月に豊岡県に統合され消滅した。
sen.e: It was abolished and consolidated into Toyooka Prefecture
It was abolished and consolidated into Toyooka Prefecture in October of that same year.
sen.cmt: Information in original field missing in translation.
sen.e: It was abolished and consolidated into Toyooka Prefecture in October of that same year.

sen.j: 県域は現在の京都府舞鶴市と大江町 (京都府)、宮津市由良のほぼ全域。
sen.e: The prefecture included present day Maizuru City, Kyoto Prefecture, Oe-cho (Kyoto prefecture) and most of Yura, Miyazu City.
The prefecture included present day Maizuru City, Kyoto Prefecture, Oe-cho (Kyoto prefecture) and most of Yura, Miyazu City.
The prefecture included present Maizuru City, Kyoto Prefecture, Oe-cho (Kyoto prefecture) and most part of Yura, Miyazu City.
Summary
Summary

sen.j: 舞鶴県は廃藩置県により各藩が県と改編されたもので、約3ヶ月だけ存在した。
sen.e: Maizuru ken was established under the policy of Haihan-chiken and lasted only three month.
Maizuru ken was established under the policy of Haihan-chiken and lasted only three months.
Maizuru Prefecture was established under the policy of Haihan-chiken and lasted only three months.

sen.j: そもそも舞鶴は丹後田辺藩であったが、和歌山県の紀伊田辺藩と重複していた。
sen.e: Maizuru Domain was originally called Tanabe Domain of Tango Province, but the name overlapped Tanabe Domain of Kii Province.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文の例外対処
sen.e: Maizuru Domain was originally called Tanabe Domain of the Tango Province, but the name overlapped with Tanabe Domain of the Kii Province.
Maizuru Domain was originally called Tanabe Domain of the Tango Province, but the name overlapped with Tanabe Domain of the Kii Province.

sen.j: そこで、太政官の命により、田辺城 (丹後国)の雅名であった舞鶴城から藩名をとって舞鶴藩にしたものである。
sen.e: Therefore, it was renamed after Maizuru-jo Castle which was a pseudonym of Tnabe-jo Castle (Tango Province) by order of Daijokan (Grand Council of State).
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文の例外対処
sen.e: Therefore, it was renamed after Maizuru-jo Castle which was a pseudonym for Tanabe-jo Castle (Tango Province) by order of the Daijokan (Grand Council of State).
Therefore, it was renamed after Maizuru-jo Castle which was a pseudonym for Tanabe-jo Castle (Tango Province) by order of the Daijokan (Grand Council of State).

sen.j: 県庁は舞鶴城におかれ、後に同じ丹後国の宮津県や峰山県とともに豊岡県に統合された。
sen.e: The prefectural government was in the Maizuru-jo Castle, but later, it was consolidated into Toyooka Prefecture along with Miyazu Prefecture and Mineyama Prefecture of the same Tango Province.
The prefectural government was in the Maizuru-jo Castle, but later, it was consolidated into Toyooka Prefecture along with Miyazu Prefecture and Mineyama Prefecture of the same Tango Province.
The prefectural government was in the Maizuru-jo Castle, but later, it was consolidated into Toyooka Prefecture along with Miyazu Prefecture and Mineyama Prefecture of the same Tango Province.
History
History
History

sen.j: 1871年（明治4年）7月14日：廃藩置県により丹後田辺藩（舞鶴藩／3.5万石）が舞鶴県として発足。
sen.e: July 14, 1871: Under the policy of Haihan-chiken, Tango-Tanabe han (Maizuru han/35,000 koku) was reorganized as Maizuru Prefecture.
July 14, 1871: Under the policy of Haihan-chiken, Tango-Tanabe han (Maizuru han/35,000 koku) was reorganized as Maizuru Prefecture.
July 14, 1871: Under the policy of Haihan-chiken, Tango-Tanabe Domain (Maizuru Domain/35,000 koku) was reorganized as Maizuru Prefecture.

sen.j: 1871年（明治4年）11月22日：豊岡県に統合
sen.e: November 22, 1871: Consolidated into Toyooka Prefecture.
November 22, 1871: Consolidated into Toyooka Prefecture.
November 22, 1871: Consolidated into Toyooka Prefecture.

sen.j: 1876年（明治9年）8月22日：豊岡県廃止により京都府へ編入。
sen.e: August 22, 1876: incorporated into Kyoto Prefecture because of the abolition of Toyooka Prefecture.
August 22, 1876: Incorporated into Kyoto Prefecture because of the abolition of Toyooka Prefecture.
August 22, 1876: Incorporated into Kyoto Prefecture because of the abolition of Toyooka Prefecture.
